title: The Division
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Qx1f9u

by AzraelGFG

Directive 51 has been enacted by the President of the United States, after the Green Flue got completely out of control and left New York in chaos. Criminals are ruling the streets, killing civilians and police alike.

Only the Agents of the Division can save the city and bring order to the chaos. Agent Sandor Clegane is on his way back to base, when he gets order to check the emergency call of a young woman.

Words: 6238, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, No Archive Warnings Apply

summary: Does anyone else every think about how if things had gone a little bit differently, Sansa, Tyrion, and Shae could’ve made a very...
body:
Does anyone else every think about how if things had gone a little bit differently, Sansa, Tyrion, and Shae could’ve made a very happy little family? Shae’s jealousy towards Sansa isn’t personal; she clearly loves Sansa and takes on a big sister or mother type role with her. Tyrion and Sansa have no romantic feelings towards one another, but Tyrion also cares about Sansa and wants to protect her. Sansa’s initial revulsion towards Tyrion grows into respect and even liking, at least until Robb’s death drives them apart.

What if Tyrion and Shae had told Sansa about their relationship? Given that Sansa certainly has no desire to sleep with Tyrion, she wouldn’t be jealous of Shae, beyond the initial shock at the idea of her husband sleeping with someone else. And Sansa’s acceptance would ease Shae’s jealousy. Once they got through the awkwardness, they could’ve continued pretending to be husband, wife, and handmaiden, while really Tyrion and Shae are a happy couple with their adopted daughter Sansa, who finally has people looking out for her.

summary: The Laws of Gods and Men
title: The Laws of Gods and Men
body:
Inspired by Like a Banner into Battle by branwyn on AO3. Go read it! Thank you to @daenerya for all of her encouragement and tolerating my bouncing ideas and questions off her :) 

Doran, Ruling Prince of Dorne has sent a letter to King Joffrey extending offerings of marriage for Sansa Stark and her best friend Diana, the last of the Amazons. 

What follows is carefully crafted politics and alliances, and the realization that the walls of the Red Keep hide more horrors than the Seven Kingdoms thought possible. 

Sansa listened to the shocked murmurs and poorly disguised laughter of the nobles filling the throne room - the titters and whispers scraping against her ears. 

Her face was burning, tears pooling in her eyes and streaking down her cheeks as she clenched the hand of her best friend and handmaiden, Diana. 

The other girl’s head was bowed, dark hair hanging like a curtain on either side of her face, shielding her from the mocking stares of those gathered. 

The back of her gown had been torn open, the laces in tatters as her free hand clutched the front against her chest in a desperate attempt to maintain her modesty. 

Blood stained the edges of the ripped brocade, leaking sluggishly from the wounds left by the flat of Ser Meryn’s blade.

Sansa shivered, warm blood from her own wounds contrasting sharply with the cool air of the throne room.

Joffrey’s cruel laughter rang in her ears as he continued to read out the letter he had received that morning from Doran Martell, the Ruling Prince of Dorne. 

“Prince Doran writes, ‘Although my brother is thirty-five years, he is most virile,’ Joffrey read out gleefully, cackling before he continued. ‘And is as yet unwed. I, myself, have recently had my marriage to my long absent wife set aside.’ The King sneered down at the parchment. ‘My brother is prepared to marry to the Lady Sansa, and I her companion, Lady Diana.’

Diana flinched at her name, daring to look up and briefly catching Margaery’s impassive gaze; but the way the Queen-to-be’s hands clenched around the fabric of her skirts betrayed her true emotions.

‘Let Dorne swear our enduring fealty and friendship to the Iron Throne by relieving you and your house of what, by all reports, are nothing more than a most tiresome and obtrusive burden.’ Joffrey taunted, childish voice grating against their ears. “They’ll take you every night like the common whores you are. They may even share you.” He promised darkly. “Ser Blount, Sec Meryn, hit the Dornish whores!”

The two men of the Kingsguard stepped forward, hauling the girls up by the backs of their necks before driving mailed fists into the tender flesh of their bellies.

Joffrey glared down at their slumped forms, at the blood dotting the immaculate marble. “Prince Doran concludes: ‘Let out loyalty to the Iron Throne, and His Grace, King Joffrey of the House Baratheon, continue with these marriages and the betrothal of Princess Myrcella to my son, Prince Trystane.’” 

“I hope you are grateful.” Cersei hissed coldly, emerald eyes as hard as the stones they embodied. “These are far better matches then you are worthy of.” She stated. “Even if they are Dornish.”

Diana and Sansa nodded demurely, features tight with pain. “Yes, Queen Mother.” Diana murmured, wounds leaking fresh blood as she shifted in her place on her knees. “Marriage to the Princes of Dorne is far more than we traitors deserve.”

Cersei smiled cruelly. “Unfortunately, they will likely get you with child soon after you are wed.” She pronounced airily. “You will likely die in childbed.”

“And then the North will be mine without contest.” Joffrey crowed, looking down at Prince Doran’s letter once more. “The letter states that they will take you with them when they return to Dorne after the engagement feast for my sister.”

Margaery spoke then, hoping to get Sansa and Diana back to her chambers as quickly as possible. “How convenient, my love.” She breathed into Joffrey’s ear, all but draping herself over him. “The sooner for us to live our lives free of traitorous reminders.”

“Agreed.” Joffrey muttered, waving a hand distractedly as Margaery pressed a kiss to his cheek. “Get out of my sight.”

The girls made to rise, biting their lips to conceal pained whimpers even as their knees threatened to buckle from underneath them.

Suddenly, Sansa found herself in a strop grip; a womanly but muscled arm wrapped firmly around her waist.

“Allow me, my lady.” Brienne murmured so only Sansa could hear. “I do not believe you are in any condition to move on your own.”

Sansa trembled, risking a glance towards the throne that Joffrey had already vacated. Her eyes met Margaery’s and the young Queen-to-be gave her a small, reassuring smile and nodded softly. 

“Thank you, Lady Brienne.” Sansa breathed, yelping softly as the lady-knight swung her up into her arms. “You are most kind.”

She looked back as Brienne began to exit the throne room, unsurprised to see Ser Jamie tenderly covering Diana in his white cloak, the dark-haired girl turning her face towards his shiny, golden chest plate as he hoisted Diana into his arms.

Diana had kept her head down during the entirety of the King’s delighted gloating, save for when she had to address Joffrey and his mother. 

She hadn’t thought she could sink any lower: first, having been Robert Baratheon’s whore, and then Joffrey’s plaything for him to exact his sadistic pleasure on.

And now, Prince Doran had laid claim to her - the last surviving daughter of the Queen of Themyscira.

The island had long ago been reduced to ruins; its temples and villas plundered and its people either murdered, enslaved or raped by Robert Baratheon and his armies.

She looked up, alarmed as Sansa’s hand slipped from hers, only breathing a sigh of relief when her eyes lit on Brienne lifting Sansa into her arms. 

Diana sighed, flinching from the gloved hand that came to rest on her shoulder.

“Easy…” Jamie breathed gently, watching Diana slump under his hand, exhaling an exhausted breath.

She shuddered as Jamie draped his white, Kingsguard cloak around her, blood from her wounds quickly soaking through the fabric.

“I’m sorry.” Jamie muttered, carefully lifting her into his arms. “I never would have–. I didn’t want to–” He stumbled over his words as he began walking out of the throne room, following Brianna towards Margaery’s chambers.

Diana whimpered quietly. “I know, Jamie.” She replied tiredly. “The blame is not with you.”

And now, Prince Doran had laid claim to her - the last surviving daughter of the Queen of Themyscira.

The island had long ago been reduced to ruins; its temples and villas plundered and its people either murdered, enslaved or raped by Robert Baratheon and his armies.

She looked up, alarmed as Sansa’s hand slipped from hers, only breathing a sigh of relief when her eyes lit on Brienne lifting Sansa into her arms. 

Diana sighed, flinching from the gloved hand that came to rest on her shoulder.

“Easy…” Jamie breathed gently, watching Diana slump under his hand, exhaling an exhausted breath.

She shuddered as Jamie draped his white, Kingsguard cloak around her, blood from her wounds quickly soaking through the fabric.

“I’m sorry.” Jamie muttered, carefully lifting her into his arms. “I never would have–. I didn’t want to–” He stumbled over his words as he began walking out of the throne room, following Brianna towards Margaery’s chambers.

Diana whimpered quietly. “I know, Jamie.” She replied tiredly. “The blame is not with you.”

What follows is carefully crafted politics and alliances, and the realization that the walls of the Red Keep hide more horrors than the Seven Kingdoms thought possible. 

Sansa listened to the shocked murmurs and poorly disguised laughter of the nobles filling the throne room - the titters and whispers scraping against her ears. 

Her face was burning, tears pooling in her eyes and streaking down her cheeks as she clenched the hand of her best friend and handmaiden, Diana. 

The other girl’s head was bowed, dark hair hanging like a curtain on either side of her face, shielding her from the mocking stares of those gathered. 

The back of her gown had been torn open, the laces in tatters as her free hand clutched the front against her chest in a desperate attempt to maintain her modesty. 

Blood stained the edges of the ripped brocade, leaking sluggishly from the wounds left by the flat of Ser Meryn’s blade.

Sansa shivered, warm blood from her own wounds contrasting sharply with the cool air of the throne room.

[[MORE]]

Joffrey’s cruel laughter rang in her ears as he continued to read out the letter he had received that morning from Doran Martell, the Ruling Prince of Dorne. 

“Prince Doran writes, ‘Although my brother is thirty-five years, he is most virile,’ Joffrey read out gleefully, cackling before he continued. ‘And is as yet unwed. I, myself, have recently had my marriage to my long absent wife set aside.’ The King sneered down at the parchment. ‘My brother is prepared to marry to the Lady Sansa, and I her companion, Lady Diana.’

Diana flinched at her name, daring to look up and briefly catching Margaery’s impassive gaze; but the way the Queen-to-be’s hands clenched around the fabric of her skirts betrayed her true emotions.

‘Let Dorne swear our enduring fealty and friendship to the Iron Throne by relieving you and your house of what, by all reports, are nothing more than a most tiresome and obtrusive burden.’ Joffrey taunted, childish voice grating against their ears. “They’ll take you every night like the common whores you are. They may even share you.” He promised darkly. “Ser Blount, Sec Meryn, hit the Dornish whores!”

The two men of the Kingsguard stepped forward, hauling the girls up by the backs of their necks before driving mailed fists into the tender flesh of their bellies.

Joffrey glared down at their slumped forms, at the blood dotting the immaculate marble. “Prince Doran concludes: ‘Let out loyalty to the Iron Throne, and His Grace, King Joffrey of the House Baratheon, continue with these marriages and the betrothal of Princess Myrcella to my son, Prince Trystane.’” 

“I hope you are grateful.” Cersei hissed coldly, emerald eyes as hard as the stones they embodied. “These are far better matches then you are worthy of.” She stated. “Even if they are Dornish.”

Diana and Sansa nodded demurely, features tight with pain. “Yes, Queen Mother.” Diana murmured, wounds leaking fresh blood as she shifted in her place on her knees. “Marriage to the Princes of Dorne is far more than we traitors deserve.”

Cersei smiled cruelly. “Unfortunately, they will likely get you with child soon after you are wed.” She pronounced airily. “You will likely die in childbed.”

“And then the North will be mine without contest.” Joffrey crowed, looking down at Prince Doran’s letter once more. “The letter states that they will take you with them when they return to Dorne after the engagement feast for my sister.”

Margaery spoke then, hoping to get Sansa and Diana back to her chambers as quickly as possible. “How convenient, my love.” She breathed into Joffrey’s ear, all but draping herself over him. “The sooner for us to live our lives free of traitorous reminders.”

“Agreed.” Joffrey muttered, waving a hand distractedly as Margaery pressed a kiss to his cheek. “Get out of my sight.”

The girls made to rise, biting their lips to conceal pained whimpers even as their knees threatened to buckle from underneath them.

Suddenly, Sansa found herself in a strop grip; a womanly but muscled arm wrapped firmly around her waist.

“Allow me, my lady.” Brienne murmured so only Sansa could hear. “I do not believe you are in any condition to move on your own.”

Sansa trembled, risking a glance towards the throne that Joffrey had already vacated. Her eyes met Margaery’s and the young Queen-to-be gave her a small, reassuring smile and nodded softly. 

“Thank you, Lady Brienne.” Sansa breathed, yelping softly as the lady-knight swung her up into her arms. “You are most kind.”

She looked back as Brienne began to exit the throne room, unsurprised to see Ser Jamie tenderly covering Diana in his white cloak, the dark-haired girl turning her face towards his shiny, golden chest plate as he hoisted Diana into his arms.

Diana had kept her head down during the entirety of the King’s delighted gloating, save for when she had to address Joffrey and his mother. 

She hadn’t thought she could sink any lower: first, having been Robert Baratheon’s whore, and then Joffrey’s plaything for him to exact his sadistic pleasure on.

And now, Prince Doran had laid claim to her - the last surviving daughter of the Queen of Themyscira.

The island had long ago been reduced to ruins; its temples and villas plundered and its people either murdered, enslaved or raped by Robert Baratheon and his armies.

She looked up, alarmed as Sansa’s hand slipped from hers, only breathing a sigh of relief when her eyes lit on Brienne lifting Sansa into her arms. 

Diana sighed, flinching from the gloved hand that came to rest on her shoulder.

“Easy…” Jamie breathed gently, watching Diana slump under his hand, exhaling an exhausted breath.

She shuddered as Jamie draped his white, Kingsguard cloak around her, blood from her wounds quickly soaking through the fabric.

“I’m sorry.” Jamie muttered, carefully lifting her into his arms. “I never would have–. I didn’t want to–” He stumbled over his words as he began walking out of the throne room, following Brianna towards Margaery’s chambers.

Diana whimpered quietly. “I know, Jamie.” She replied tiredly. “The blame is not with you.”

summary: Do you think Doran or Oberyn would have rescued Sansa during her time as a hostage? I have read some really good fics but all of...
question: Do you think Doran or Oberyn would have rescued Sansa during her time as a hostage? I have read some really good fics but all of them go icky (Oberyn or Doran as LI).
answer:
How do you mean? Like if she’d have been of their House? (I definitely think they’d have done everything to get her back in that case.) But in the story as we know it, they have little reason to try to help Sansa. It’s not just Oberyn playing Captain Save a Maiden, it would be a political and diplomatic shitshow if they somehow stole away Tywin Lannister’s (however unwilling) daughter in law, and way more trouble than it’s worth. She’s none of their concern.

We know from Oberyn that he wanted Tyrion to come to Dorne with Sansa- the lovely Lady of Winterfell- in tow, away from King’s Landing, so they certainly had use for her. But like every other character, it’s (understandably) about her claim and how they can benefit from association, rather than any genuine care for her wellbeing. Although I do think of all the people who wanted something from Sansa, the Martells would have treated her the best and she might just have been happy in Dorne (she might have made some real friends too), had she ever gone. But just not with any purely altruistic motives from Doran or Oberyn.

summary:
No WAY is Tyrion going to bring Sansa to Cersei.
That would be way out of character especially since one of Tyrion's main...
body:
No WAY is Tyrion going to bring Sansa to Cersei.

That would be way out of character especially since one of Tyrion’s main feelings about Sansa was empathizing with her when she was a prisoner of his family.

“I only want to be loyal.”

“Loyal,” the dwarf mused, “and far from any Lannisters. I can scarce blame you for that. When I was your age, I wanted the same thing.”

Tyrion saw Sansa being abused by his family and specifically identified with that feeling of being trapped by your abusers. No way would he put her in that situation again, especially for Cersei.

body:
Will Cersei Make A Play For Winterfell? You Bet Your Ass She Will!

I briefly discussed this yesterday with @puresummermagic and it’s been a topic I’ve been thinking about for awhile. I personally believe that Cersei will absolutely make a play for Winterfell. I’m willing to bet money on it! Why you ask? Well because essentially the two smartest players in the game brought up the importance of not ignoring/forgetting Cersei and 100% imply that she will make a play! Sansa and Littlefinger were the only people who were taking the Cersei threat seriously and are not underestimating her at all!

In the scene above here’s the most important parts of Jon and Sansa’s dialogue:

Sansa:”You’ve been so consumed with the enemy in the North you’ve forgotten about the one to the south.”

Sansa: “We still have a wall between us and the Night King there’s nothing between us and Cersei.”

Jon: “There’s a thousand miles between us and Cersei. Winter is here the Lannister’s are a southern army. They’ll NEVER range this far North.”

Sansa: “You’re the military man but I KNOW HER. If your her enemy, She’ll Never Stop until she’s destroyed you. Everyone who’s ever crossed her she’s found a way to murder!”

Y’all this entire dialogue is so important! It wasn’t just filler for the show. There’s one important point I want to bring up about this scene. I love that fact that Sansa makes it explicitly clear to Jon that she knows Cersei. She is fully aware of who they’re enemy is and what she’s capable of. Apart from the stories Jon’s heard and the atrocities Cersei has brought upon his family, he doesn’t know shit about Cersei! He hasn’t had firsthand experience of her cruelty and shouldn’t assume that he knows what she’s capable of or whether or not she’s a viable threat because of winter. Honestly that’s silly.

For some reason this scene makes me think of Olenna’s words to Jaimie here:

In this scene Olenna says:

“Whatever I imagined necessary for House Tyrell I did, but your sister has done things I wasn’t capabale of imagining. That was my prized mistake a failure of imagination!”

This is the enemy that Jon and Sansa are dealing with. This is what Jon fails to understand. This is a person who is capable of doing things that even some of the smartest game players couldn’t even fathom. Olenna’s words also reminds me of this scene:

Littlefinger mentions that the northerners are solely focused on the threat beyond the wall.

Sansa: “As they should be.”

Littlefinger:”I know Cersei better than anyone here. If you turn your back on her……”

Y’all, the show is making it perfectly clear that Cersei is a threat that should equally be taken as seriously as the Night King. Make no mistake, Sansa absolutely agrees with Littlefingers assessment of the situation. She’s already ahead of the game which is why she broached this same topic with Jon in the first episode of the season. But of course, she’s not going to openly agree with Littlefinger and let him know her thoughts. She’s going to continue to do her part to prepare her people for the long night.

Anyway back to the meta!

After Sansa states that she’s fully aware of how dangerous Cersei is Littlefinger’s response is this:

“Fight every battle everywhere always in your mind. Everyone is your enemy, everyone is your friend. Every possible series of events is happening all at once; Live that way and nothing will surprise you! Everything that happens will be something that you’ve seen before! “

I think this is foreshadowing of Game of Thrones in general but I also think this is foreshadowing particularly pertaining to Cersei. I mean how can it not be! This was the piece of advice Littlefinger gave Sansa after discussing Cersei! Also this definitely makes Olenna’s words come to life.

Where Olenna failed was that she couldn’t think about the endless POSSIBILITIES that Cersei could see to her families demise. Her imagination wasn’t big enough. Essentially what Littlefinger is telling Sansa here is that she needs to always stretch the boundaries of her imagination. She needs to always think about every possibility certain situations can play out so that she can never be caught off guard.

Cersei has absolutely no problem in this department. This is the same women who stays up all night thinking about ways she can get her revenge/kill her enemies. Her imagination knows no boundaries and she’s down to do whatever is necessary to accomplish her goals.

That’s why I believe without a doubt that Cersei is going make a play for Winterfell! Winter or not if she wants to do something she’s going to do it! I can totally see Cersei attacking Winterfell as the Night King is attacking Winterfell, I can see her kidnapping Sansa, I can see her doing a lot of crazy shit! The point is Cersei is not going to sit on the Iron Throne and wait for her enemies to arrive at her doorstep! She always has a game going on behind the scenes and I fully expect for her to pull out her biggest tricks in the last season.
